meanings.definition: A band or bundle of fibrous tissue in a human or animal body that has the ability to contract, producing movement in or maintaining the position of parts of the body.
meanings.sent1: Her muscles tensed as she lifted the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often train their muscles to become stronger.
meanings.sent3: The muscles of the old rocking chair creaked as he sat down.
meanings.sent4: The muscles of the city, its infrastructure, kept it running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The muscles of the river flowed steadily towards the sea.

meanings.definition: Strength or force of body or mind; power of sustained exertion, controlled by the will.
meanings.sent1: His muscles of determination helped him finish the marathon.
meanings.sent2: The muscles of her argument convinced everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The muscles of his resolve never wavered, even in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent4: The muscles of the team's unity propelled them to victory.
meanings.sent5: The muscles of her courage shone brightly in the darkness.
